info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Quick Hitting Heavy Snow Showers Early this Afternoon... A period of briefly heavy-falling snow showers will move through northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana through 230 PM, including the Chicago metro. Quick reduction in visibility to under one quarter of a mile has been observed and will continue with these snow showers. The rather short duration of the heavier snow bursts should result in only minor accumulations, but enough to quickly coat the roads and cause impacts. Since roads will likely become at least lightly snow covered, anyone planning to drive through early afternoon should leave extra travel time and use extra caution, with increased following distance.
